name: discover-commands
description:
Search CLI commands by keyword or capability. Use this first when unsure which command to use.

Common queries:
- 'list' or 'export entries' → list export (for list-specific data)
- 'company' or 'search companies' → company ls (for global search)
- 'person' → person ls, person get
- 'create' or 'add' → write commands (use category='write')
- 'interaction' or 'meeting' → interaction commands
- 'history' or 'audit' or 'track changes' → field history (see who changed field values and when)

Tip: Start with category='read' or category='write' to narrow results.

query.description: What you want to do in plain English (e.g., 'find companies on a list', 'create person', 'log a meeting', 'export list entries')

detail.description: Detail level: 'list' (names only), 'summary' (+ description), 'full' (+ parameters). Use 'full' when you need filter syntax.

category.description: Filter by operation type: 'read' (ls, get, export), 'write' (create, update, delete), 'local' (config), 'all'
